title: Interlacing triangles, Schubert puzzles, and graph colorings
abstract:
We show that interlacing triangular arrays, introduced by
Aggarwal-Borodin-Wheeler to study certain probability measures, can be used to
compute structure constants for multiplying Schubert classes in the $K$-theory
of Grassmannians, in the cohomology of their cotangent bundles, and in the
cohomology of partial flag varieties. Our results are achieved by establishing
a splitting lemma, allowing for interlacing triangular arrays of high rank to
be decomposed into arrays of lower rank, and by constructing a bijection
between interlacing triangular arrays of rank 3 with certain proper vertex
colorings of the triangular grid graph that factors through generalizations of
Knutson-Tao puzzles. Along the way, we prove one enumerative conjecture of
Aggarwal-Borodin-Wheeler and disprove another.
